result.execSummary:
The defendant Samuel A Pientka was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Samuel A Pientka in court with attorney Jerod Barkley. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
11:10 a.m. Court calls the case. 

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: Counts 2 & 3 - NO CONTEST

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty Counts 2 & 3.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
Count 1 is dismissed and read-in. 

Atty Constable makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Barkley makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Defendant makes statements to the Court. 

BY THE COURT:
Counts 2 & 3 - 
Pay fine of $100 plus costs including the DNA and Domestic Abuse Surcharge.  To be paid within 60 days or set up a payment plan. 
Submit a DNA sample, if not already done so.

TAPE RECORDED: 10:53:27:
Defendant Samuel A Pientka in court with attorney Jerod Barkley. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Matter was scheduled already for plea hearing in Feb. 2016.
TAPE RECORD END: 10:55
The Family Center - Safety Plan filed by K. McCormick
Portage County Community Justice Program Court Referral Form

Sign and deposit $200 to get out of jail.  Wage assignment $50 per pay period until a total of $1,000 bond is on file.

7/6/15  Bond amended to include: 
Do not have direct/indirect contact with the following persons/places:  *K.L.M. 08/05/87  *Unless the victim goes to CAP Services to get a Family Safety Plan and then files the form with the Clerk of Courts and District Attorney.  If filed, then no abusive contact with the above named.
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Any contact is to be while he is absolutely sober. 
Report alcohol and drug free to the Day Report Center no less than the following times per week:  *3 times per week.

Atty Barkley makes arguments re: motion to modify bond with re; to the no contact. 
Atty Constable recommends it be modified to no abusive contact. 

Court questions Ms. McCracken. 
Ms. McCracken does wish to have contact with the defendant.  

BY THE COURT:  Court amends with additional conditions.

State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY Plea(s) entered.

Defendant Samuel A Pientka in court with attorney Jerod Barkley. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions Attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 24, 2015 at 09:00 am.
for Attorney to Appear and Act

2:00 p.m. Defendant Samuel A Pientka in court with attorney Jerod Barkley. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant/Attorney received copy of Criminal Complaint and waived its reading.
Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties.
Prelim time limits waived.
Atty Barkley requests bond modification as the Victim is present and is requesting the no contact be removed.
ADA Knaapen states this is ADA Constable case.
Court informs Atty Barkley to put his motion in writing.
Bond is continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 6, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Samuel A Pientka in court. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant received a copy of the Criminal Complaint
Defendant waives reading of Criminal Complaint (copy was given to the Defendant in Court today).
Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties
Court advises defendant of right to counsel and can contact Public Defender's office for representation.
Defendant would like to consult with an attorney
Defendant did contact Public Defender for Representation and is eligible.
Letter in file - Defendant to get an attorney to address any motions.
Bond continued.
  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 8, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
